item.title: Ticket #2676 (posts_per_rss option not validated) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Leaving posts_per_rss option value empty breaks feeds. It could be forced to a positive integer.

Also, we should handle feed 404's differently because right now the 404 template is used if no posts are found.

item.title: Ticket #2675 (Error when upgrading with no links/bookmarks) created
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description:
When upgrading using the latest trunk code, I get this error because I have no links in my current DB: 

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in wp-admin\upgrade-functions.php on line 525

It does a foreach without checking if $links is null: 

		$links = $wpdb->get_results("SELECT link_id, link_category FROM $wpdb->links");
		foreach ( $links as $link ) {

invalid:

item.title: Ticket #2674 (Apostrophes in posts cause SQL errors) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Try writing a post containing an apostrophe, with or without tinyMCE.

item.title: Ticket #2667 (The JS delete confirm box doesn't show when you search in "manage pages") closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
worksforme:

I can't replicate. In the "Are you sure" dialog, no ID is present with or without searching. Pressing "OK" confirms and the delete goes through.

Reopen if you can be more precise in what you mean.

item.title: Ticket #2673 (Page navigation in categories fails with permalinks) created
item.dc:creator: timweber
item.description:
Quoting from RichardF in the support forum ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/41751?replies=14 :

I have the standard permalink structure and have replaced %postname% with %post_id%: as follows /index.php/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%post_id%/. I'm able to access all of my pages with this structure.

When I look at my home page which breaks at 10 posts - I can click on the next link and it takes me to /index.php/page/2/ - everything seems to work.

When I look at a category page with more than 10 posts and click on the next link it also takes me to /index.php/page/2/ instead of /index.php/category/category-name/page/2/.

I'm using IIS 6 on a W2003 server.

It looks like posts_nav_link doesn't pick up permalink structure. By the way when I remove the permalink structure everything works ok.

item.title: admin-header.diff attached to Ticket #2672
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe

item.title: Ticket #2672 (JS error when editing post for Contributors) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
On the edit post screen, there are two things which use the list manipulation JS: on the fly category addition and custom fields.

Currently, the JS is only included if ( current_user_can('manage_categories') ), so a user who can't will get a JS error when the custom fields JS runs.

Trivial patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #2231 (Edit shows first version of post) updated
item.dc:creator: miscblogger
item.description: I posted an easy plugin fix to this glitch on my blog: ​http://www.hackernotcracker.com/2006-04/plugin-fix-for-wordpress-edit-post-cache-bug.html

item.title: Ticket #2671 (New filter hook for filtering comments at display-time) created
item.dc:creator: korey99
item.description:
Requesting a new filter hook that would allow a plugin to filter which comments get displayed on a page or post.

The default comments template has an array of the comments which are looped through to display each comment. This filter should allow a plugin to modify that array. The primary driver is to remove items from that array, but modifying the comments within the array would be a plus.

item.title: Ticket #2359 (Excess "Uncategorized" posts in post2cat table) updated
item.dc:creator: nevans
item.description:
Keywords, Status changed

Here's a patch. When applied, Wordpress will not create post2cat entries for attachments. It will, however, attempt to delete post2cat entries. I thought it to be prudent to leave that in so Wordpress would clean up its mess...

Regards.
